intro: Artanthe pothifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf artanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white, waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and purple, typically during the summer months. Artanthe pothifolia is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
